subject: RE: [junit] Help needed
msgSnippet: Why don t you just test the public methods? If aa() and bb() are helper methods that came about from re-factoring you can ignore them. Just make sure you
messageBody:
Why don't you just test the public methods?

If aa() and bb() are 'helper' methods that came about from re-factoring you
can ignore them.

Just make sure you test XYZ() with all the necessary parameters and leave it
at that. If XYZ is passing the wrong values to aa() and bb() then the unit
test that stresses XYZ() will fail. Right?

James

-----Original Message-----
From: mona ahuja [mailto:mahuja@...]
Sent: 29 January 2004 00:05
To: junit@yahoogroups.com'" <junit@yahoogroups.com>"
Subject: [junit] Help needed


Hi,
I have a question if I have a method in a class which calls 2 other methods
of the same class. How do unit test this method.How do I check if its
passing correct parameters to other methods. eg
method XYZ()
{
int x;
int y;
aa(x);
bb(y);
}
aa() ,bb(),XYZ() are all methods of the same class.
I can unit test aa() and bb()in isolation but how do I test that methos XYZ
is passing correct values tp aa and bb
